translations.english_saheeh: When the sky has split [open]
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. When the heaven is split asunder,
translations.english_rwwad: When the sky is rent asunder,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1888]- It will have heard Allāh's command and will have inclined immediately to compliance and willing obedience.

translations.english_saheeh: And has listened [i.e., responded][1888] to its Lord and was obligated [to do so]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And listens to and obeys its Lord - and it must do so.
translations.english_rwwad: and hearkens to its Lord, as it must,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1889]- i.e., stretched flat and spread out.

translations.english_saheeh: And when the earth has been extended[1889]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the earth is stretched forth,
translations.english_rwwad: and when the earth is leveled out,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1890]- Of the dead and all else buried therein.

translations.english_saheeh: And has cast out that within it[1890] and relinquished [it].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And has cast out all that was in it and became empty.
translations.english_rwwad: and casts out all what it contains, and becomes empty,

translations.english_saheeh: And has listened [i.e., responded] to its Lord and was obligated [to do so] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And listens to and obeys its Lord - and it must do so.
translations.english_rwwad: and hearkens to its Lord, as it must,

arabic_text: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدۡحٗا فَمُلَٰقِيهِ
phonetic: 84.6 Yā 'Ayyuhā Al-'Insānu 'Innaka Kādiĥun 'Ilá Rabbika Kadĥāan Famulāqīhi

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[1891]- i.e., striving throughout your life until you meet your Lord, hastening toward death.
[1892]- i.e., you will find all that you intended and accomplished awaiting you in the Hereafter. Another meaning is "And will meet Him [i.e., your Lord]" and be recompensed in full by Him.

translations.english_saheeh: O mankind, indeed you are laboring toward your Lord with [great] exertion[1891] and will meet it.[1892]
translations.english_hilali_khan: O man! Verily, you are returning towards your Lord with your deeds and actions (good or bad), a sure returning, and you will meet (the results of your deeds which you did).
translations.english_rwwad: O humans, you are toiling towards your Lord, and you will surely meet Him.

translations.english_saheeh: Then as for he who is given his record in his right hand,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then as for him who will be given his Record in his right hand,
translations.english_rwwad: Whoever is given his Record in his right hand,

translations.english_saheeh: He will be judged with an easy account
translations.english_hilali_khan: He surely will receive an easy reckoning,
translations.english_rwwad: he will have an easy reckoning,

translations.english_saheeh: And return to his people in happiness.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And will return to his family in joy!
translations.english_rwwad: and he will return to his people joyfully.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ وَرَآءَ ظَهۡرِهِۦ

translations.english_saheeh: But as for he who is given his record behind his back,
translations.english_hilali_khan: But whosoever is given his Record behind his back,
translations.english_rwwad: But whoever is given his Record from behind his back,

translations.english_saheeh: He will cry out for destruction
translations.english_hilali_khan: He will invoke (for his) destruction,
translations.english_rwwad: he will call out for destruction,

translations.english_saheeh: And [enter to] burn in a Blaze.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And he shall enter a blazing Fire, and be made to taste its burning.
translations.english_rwwad: and he will enter the Blazing Fire.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, he had [once] been among his people in happiness;
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, he was among his people in joy!
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, he used to live among his people joyfully.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, he had thought he would never return [to Allāh].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, he thought that he would never come back (to Us)!
translations.english_rwwad: and he thought that he would never return [to Allah].

arabic_text: بَلَىٰٓۚ إِنَّ رَبَّهُۥ كَانَ بِهِۦ بَصِيرٗا

translations.english_saheeh: But yes! Indeed, his Lord was ever, of him, Seeing.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Yes! Verily, his Lord has been ever beholding him!
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed he will! His Lord was always watching him.

translations.english_saheeh: So I swear by the twilight glow
translations.english_hilali_khan: So I swear by the afterglow of sunset;
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, I swear by the twilight,

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the night and what it envelops
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the night and whatever it gathers in its darkness,
translations.english_rwwad: and by the night and what it covers,

translations.english_saheeh: And [by] the moon when it becomes full
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by the moon when it is at the full.
translations.english_rwwad: and by the moon when it becomes full,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1893]- i.e., various stages, both in this life and in the Hereafter.

translations.english_saheeh: [That] you will surely embark upon [i.e., experience] state after state.[1893]
translations.english_hilali_khan: You shall certainly travel from stage to stage (in this life and in the Hereafter).
translations.english_rwwad: You will surely pass from one stage to another.

translations.english_saheeh: So what is [the matter] with them [that] they do not believe,
translations.english_hilali_khan: What is the matter with them, that they believe not?
translations.english_rwwad: Then what is the matter with them that they do not believe,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانُ لَا يَسۡجُدُونَۤ۩

translations.english_saheeh: And when the Qur’ān is recited to them, they do not prostrate [to Allāh]?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the Qur’ân is recited to them, they fall not prostrate.
translations.english_rwwad: and when the Qur’an is recited to them, they do not prostrate?

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.84:22) It is obligatory to have Belief in the Messengership of the Prophet (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم). Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه : Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "By Him (Allâh) in Whose Hand Muhammad’s soul is, there is none from amongst the Jews and Christians (of these present nations) who hears about me and then dies without believing in the Message with which I have been sent (i.e. Islâmic Monotheism), but he will be from the dwellers of the (Hell) Fire." (Sahih Muslim, the Book of Faith, Vol. 1, Chapter No.240). See also (V.3:85) and (V.3:116).

translations.english_saheeh: But those who have disbelieved deny,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, those who disbelieve belie (Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم and whatever he brought, i.e. this Qur’ân and Islâmic Monotheism, etc.).[1]
translations.english_rwwad: Rather, the disbelievers persist in denying it,

translations.english_saheeh: And Allāh is most knowing of what they keep within themselves.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Allâh knows best what they gather (of good and bad deeds),
translations.english_rwwad: but Allah knows best whatever they harbor in their hearts.

translations.english_saheeh: So give them tidings of a painful punishment,
translations.english_hilali_khan: So announce to them a painful torment.
translations.english_rwwad: So give them the tidings of a painful punishment.

arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَيۡرُ مَمۡنُونِۭ
phonetic: 84.25 'Illā Al-Ladhīna 'Āmanū Wa `Amilū Aş-Şāliĥāti Lahum 'Ajrun Ghayru Mamnūnin

translations.english_saheeh: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds. For them is a reward uninterrupted.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Save those who believe and do righteous good deeds, for them is a reward that will never come to an end (i.e. Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: But those who believe and do righteous deeds will have a never-ending reward.
